intro: Leucosceptrum stellipilum var. tosaense, commonly known as the Tosa leucosceptrum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically evergreen, glossy, and elliptical in shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
